svcsubproc.title: Body Attachment
svcsubproc.para: The bus body tie downs vary in type and location in the bus structure. Each type of tie down application has an individual function in securing the overall bus substructure
The "J" clip and bolt encapsulate the chassis lower frame rail flange and floor structure. The "J" bolt mountings should be checked periodically to ensure the proper alignment and condition.

step1.para: Locate the lock nut and washer located at the top of the "J" clip and bolt.

step2.para: Loosen the "J" clip bolt lock nut at the floor structure flange and remove.

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. "J" CLIP MOUNTING ROD, NUTS AND WASHERS

step2.para: Slide the "J" clip bolt out of the floor panel flange.

step1.para: Shear bolt tie down is located at the rear section of the bus body. If the body has shifted more than is allowable the shear bolt will shear. If the shear bolt has sheared, the bus body has moved; check all remaining body tie-downs. Report the condition to the bus fleet manager.

step2.para: The shear bolt would not necessarily be changed other than in the case of body shifting on the chassis.
Periodically, the shear bolts should be checked for tightness.
If the bolts have to be tightened they should be torqued. (See the torque chart for the required torque values)

step1.para: The formed tie downs are the main structural body tie downs. The formed tie downs are located at the flange sections of the bus floor assembly and are secured at the inside of the upper flange of the frame rail. These tie downs should be checked for any possible movement, also checking for the anti-squeak pads. If the squeak pads are missing, the formed tie down clip may not be sufficiently retaining the floor section in place.
To remove formed tie down clip:

step2.para: Locate the lock nut on formed tie down clip at the floor assembly lower flange.
Loosen the lock nut and remove the bolt.
Remove the formed tie down clip.

svcsubproc.para: The outrigger tie down assembly is located behind the cowl assembly. The driver side outrigger is mounted at the driver platform sub-structure.

step1.para: The outrigger tie-downs are located at the outer flange on the body outrigger assemblies. The outrigger assemblies are bolted to the chassis frame rail. They are a spring mounted type assembly with bolt and lock nut.

step2.para: Locate the outrigger end and tie-down hardware.

figure.caption: Figure 198. Outrigger Tension Bolt Assembly Remove

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. TIE DOWN WASHERS (NUT NOT SHOWN AT TOP)

step2.para: Loosen and remove the lock nut and washer from the spring assembly.
Remove the tie-down mounting bolt and spring assembly.
Locate the outrigger mounting bolts attaching the outrigger to the chassis frame rail.

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. OUTRIGGER ASSEMBLY MOUNTING BOLTS AND NUTS

step2.para: Loosen and remove the outrigger mounting bolts nuts and washers.
